thread.title: Welcome to the Rock: Gullickson to host strength clinic
thread.title_full: Welcome to the Rock: Gullickson to host strength clinic

title: Welcome to the Rock: Gullickson to host strength clinic
text:
Manage Welcome to the Rock: Gullickson to host strength clinic It’s unclear if promotional materials and signs might say, “Welcome to the Rock!,” but new University of Tennessee strength and conditioning director Rock   (Photo: Ryan Callahan, 247Sports) 
It’s unclear if promotional materials and signs might say, “Welcome to the Rock!,” but new University of Tennessee strength and conditioning director Rock Gullickson has announced an impressive lineup for Gullickson’s first-ever strength clinic with the Vols. 
UT on Tuesday released that Gullickson is hosting his inaugural Rocky Top clinic in 11 days on Saturday, Feb. 25 --- the school's 34th annual strength session. 
Per UT’s release, the event will: “This clinic is designed to provide high school coaches, collegiate coaches and parents with an annual fitness and strength and conditioning plan. The event will run from 7 a.m. ET to 2:40 p.m. ET and is open to coaches from the high school, club and junior high levels, college sport and strength coaches, athletic trainers, physical therapists, personal trainers and fitness professionals.” 
(What's next for the Vols?   Gullickson is drawing in some impressive guest-lecturers and instructors, most notably Louisville’s top strength man Joe Miday and Texas Tech’s Rusty Whitt. Gullickson is a former head strength director at Louisville. 
The camp’s cost is $45, and it does count toward CEU hours for certified strength coaches. For more information or to register, visit www.tennesseesportscamps.com. Author
